name: Book of Hours
maker: Master of Guillebert de Mets, and Master of the Lee Hours, and Master of Wauquelin's Alexander
description: Book of Hours; Master of Guillebert de Mets (Flemish, active about 1410 - 1450), and Master of the Lee Hours (Flemish, active about 1450 - 1470), and Master of Wauquelin's Alexander (Flemish, active about 1440 - 1460); Ghent (probably), Belgium; about 1450 - 1455; Tempera colors, gold leaf, and ink on parchment bound between pasteboard covered with late sixteenth-century Flemish (?) calf; Leaf: 19.4 × 14 cm (7 5/8 × 5 1/2 in.); Ms. 2; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
title: Book of Hours
medium: Tempera colors, gold leaf, and ink on parchment bound between pasteboard covered with late sixteenth-century Flemish (?) calf
